meanings.definition: The act of wiggling or moving with quick, jerky motions.
meanings.sent1: During the dance, her wiggery added a fun element to the performance.
meanings.sent2: The toddler's wiggery while trying to escape his mother's grasp was adorable.
meanings.sent3: The wiggery of the puppy trying to catch its tail was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The wiggery of the squirrel as it darted across the yard was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: Her wiggery on the dance floor made her the center of attention.

meanings.sent1: His wiggery in trying to cover up the truth only made matters worse.
meanings.sent2: The politician's wiggery was eventually exposed by investigative journalists.
meanings.sent3: The wiggery of the fox as it tried to trick the crow out of its food was unsuccessful.
meanings.sent4: Her wiggery in pretending to be someone else was finally revealed at the party.
meanings.sent5: The wiggery of the con artist was finally brought to light by the authorities.

meanings.definition: A collection of wigs or wig-making materials.
meanings.sent1: The theater's wiggery contained a variety of styles for different characters.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours organizing her wiggery for the upcoming play.
meanings.sent3: The wiggery of colorful wigs made the costume party even more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The wiggery of synthetic hair and styling tools filled the small room.
meanings.sent5: Her wiggery of wigs and hairpieces was the envy of all her friends.
